abstract: Simon & Schuster, Random House and the Hachette Book Group said they would allow authors to access book sales data online, a service Amazon began providing last year.
snippet: Simon & Schuster, Random House and the Hachette Book Group said they would allow authors to access book sales data online, a service Amazon began providing last year.
lead_paragraph: Three major publishers said on Wednesday that they would allow their authors to access book sales data directly online, a move that appeared to challenge Amazon and its continued efforts to woo authors.

headline.main: Authors to Get Sales Data Online From 3 Big Publishers
headline.print_headline: Authors to Get Sales Data Online From 3 Big Publishers
